metadata.title: CVE-2017-6369 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient checks in the UDF subsystem in Firebird 2.5.x before 2.5.7 and3.0.x before 3.0.2 allow remote authenticated users to execute code byusing a 'system' entrypoint from fbudf.so.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firebird3.0-common - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
firebird3.0-examples - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
firebird3.0-server - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
firebird3.0-server-core - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
firebird3.0-utils - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
libfbclient2 - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
libib-util - 3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firebird3.0 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.2.32703.ds4-11ubuntu2').
